001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.allure;
002
003import io.qameta.allure.Allure;
004import io.qameta.allure.junit5.AllureJunit5;
005import io.qameta.allure.model.Status;
006import io.qameta.allure.model.StepResult;
007import java.util.UUID;
008
009/**
010 * Custom Allure listener for managing structured Allure steps and test lifecycle.
011 *
012 * <p>This class extends {@link AllureJunit5} to provide additional functionality for tracking parent and nested steps
013 * in Allure reports. It ensures proper test structuring, supports dynamic step statuses, and enables test ID tracking.
014 *
015 * <p>Features:
016 * <ul>
017 *     <li>Tracks parent steps and child steps in Allure reports.</li>
018 *     <li>Manages step statuses dynamically (INFO, SUCCESS, WARNING, ERROR).</li>
019 *     <li>Supports clearing and setting test identifiers for traceability.</li>
020 * </ul>
021 *
022 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
023 */
024public class CustomAllureListener extends AllureJunit5 {
025
026   /**
027    * Thread-local storage for the current step name.
028    */
029   private static final ThreadLocal<String> STEP_NAME = new ThreadLocal<>();
030
031   /**
032    * Enumeration for defining different step status types in Allure reporting.
033    *
034    * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
035    */
036   public enum StatusType {
037      /**
038       * Represents a neutral step with no explicit status.
039       */
040      DEFAULT,
041
042      /**
043       * Indicates an informational step.
044       */
045      INFO,
046
047      /**
048       * Marks the step as successfully completed.
049       */
050      SUCCESS,
051
052      /**
053       * Marks the step as a warning (e.g., partial failure).
054       */
055      WARNING,
056
057      /**
058       * Marks the step as an error (e.g., assertion failure).
059       */
060      ERROR
061   }
062
063   /**
064    * Starts a new step.
065    *
066    * <p>This method creates a new step entry in Allure and sets the step name variable.
067    * </p>
068    *
069    * @param name The name of the step.
070    * @param type The status type of the step.
071    */
072   private static void startStep(String name, StatusType type) {
073      String uuid = UUID.randomUUID().toString();
074      StepResult stepResult = new StepResult().setName(name);
075      applyStepType(stepResult, type);
076
077      Allure.getLifecycle().startStep(uuid, stepResult);
078      STEP_NAME.set(name);
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Starts a new step using a predefined {@link StepType}.
083    *
084    * @param stepType The predefined step type.
085    */
086   public static void startStep(StepType stepType) {
087      startStep(stepType.getDisplayName(), StatusType.DEFAULT);
088   }
089
090   /**
091    * Starts a new step with a custom name.
092    *
093    * @param stepName The name of the step.
094    */
095   public static void startStep(String stepName) {
096      startStep(stepName, StatusType.DEFAULT);
097   }
098
099   /**
100    * Starts a new step with a custom name and predefined {@link StatusType}.
101    *
102    * @param stepName   The name of the step.
103    * @param statusType The predefined status type.
104    */
105   public static void startStepWithStatusType(String stepName, StatusType statusType) {
106      startStep(stepName, statusType);
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Stops the most recently started step.
111    */
112   public static void stopStep() {
113      Allure.getLifecycle().stopStep();
114      STEP_NAME.remove();
115   }
116
117   /**
118    * Checks if a specific step name is currently active.
119    *
120    * @param stepName The step name to check.
121    * @return {@code true} if the specified step with name is active, otherwise {@code false}.
122    */
123   public static boolean isStepActive(String stepName) {
124      return stepName.equals(STEP_NAME.get());
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Retrieves active step name.
129    *
130    * @return active step name.
131    */
132   public static String getActiveStepName() {
133      return STEP_NAME.get();
134   }
135
136   /**
137    * Applies the appropriate Allure step status based on the provided {@link StatusType}.
138    *
139    * @param stepResult The step result to modify.
140    * @param type       The status type to apply.
141    */
142   private static void applyStepType(StepResult stepResult, StatusType type) {
143      if (type == null) {
144         type = StatusType.DEFAULT;
145      }
146
147      switch (type) {
148         case INFO:
149            stepResult.setStatus(Status.SKIPPED);
150            break;
151         case SUCCESS:
152            stepResult.setStatus(Status.PASSED);
153            break;
154         case WARNING:
155            stepResult.setStatus(Status.BROKEN);
156            break;
157         case ERROR:
158            stepResult.setStatus(Status.FAILED);
159            break;
160         case DEFAULT:
161         default:
162            break;
163      }
164   }
165
166}
